title: Science Inquiry Lesson Design Project Based on the Six Thinking Hats Model: Structured Group Reflection for Pre-Service Teachers

context.prior_knowledge: Advanced science education theories, mastery of high-level applied technologies, and basic comprehension of the scientific inquiry process
context.additional_context: Conducted in a BYOD environment, emphasizing science-based project design and structured group reflection activities through the Six Thinking Hats model. Focuses on enhancing scientific inquiry skills such as experimental design, variable control, and data analysis.

learning_goals: Learners Can Perform Structured Collective Reflection on Science Inquiry Lesson Design Projects with Peer Preservice Teachers Using Each Thinking Mode of the Six Thinking Hats Model

Learners Establish Project Monitoring and Improvement Plans Centering on the Blue Hat (Facilitator) Role and Demonstrate Co-Regulation Competencies Regarding Scientific Variables and Experimental Design
Learners Apply Evaluation-Regulation-Centered Reflection Patterns to Establish Self-Assessment and Evidence-Based Implementation Strategies for Science Lesson Design Projects

resources: Zoom Account & Real-Time Collaboration Tools (Miro, Jamboard, etc.)

difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
